content_list.content:
A refreshing swim in the pool is a welcome treat during the hottest part of the summer. However, regular upkeep is required to keep the water in pools safe and enjoyable for swimmers. You may accomplish this with the use of a solar pool cover. Solar pool covers do more than keep leaves and other debris out of the water; they are also made to keep the water heated when the temperature outside drops at night or later in the summer.


Since they lessen heat and chlorine loss while the pool is unoccupied, they may also help you save money on your power bills and chemical costs. We discussed solar pool covers and how to choose the best one with swimming pool professionals. Using their advice, we compiled a list of products that have received overwhelmingly positive customer feedback.


Things To Look for In a Solar Pool Cover

⮚ The most important aspects of a solar pool cover are its dimensions, thickness, and color.


⮚ Pool covers need to reach from one side of the pool to the other without any gaps. Solar pool covers of over 800 square feet can easily cost over $200, whereas covers of 100 square feet or less can be purchased for $100 or less. Most pool covers allow you to trim them down to fit without voiding the guarantee if they are too big.


⮚ According to Gilda Dobrica, founder of ProSwim NYC and author of the Teach-Your-Child-To-Swim e-course, thicker pool coverings (14 to 16 mils) should provide superior insulation in colder, windier locations. Pool coverings with a thickness of 8 to 10 mils may be purchased for roughly $100 less and may be enough in warmer climes. Solar pool coverings in the 10–12 mm thick range are considered medium.


⮚ To get the most out of your solar pool cover, choose blue. Dobrica informed us that a pool liner with a UV-protected transparent blue tint provides an optimal balance between heat retention and chemical protection. According to Dobrica, a clear cover will let the greatest heat into the pool and let in more UV rays, which might reduce chlorine's disinfecting power. Algae blooms can be caused by a lack of chlorine or other chemical treatments that maintain the pool's chemistry.


A Solar Pool Cover and Its Benefits

A solar pool blanket is designed to assist the pool water in warming up gradually during the day and to keep the pool sheltered at night so that more heat is retained after the sun goes down. These solar pool covers may not be as effective compared to electric or gas pool heaters, but they are significantly cheaper.


Users may cut costs in more places than just the purchase price. Solar pool blankets also decrease the quantity of water lost to evaporation from the pool surface. As a result, the amount of chlorine needed for the pool will be lower during the swimming season.


• By absorbing and amplifying the sun's rays, a solar blanket helps bring the temperature of the water up while also allowing more heat to be retained.

● Purchasing one of these solar pool covers is a better financial decision than purchasing a pool heater.

• A solar blanket will reduce the pool water's evaporation rate, which will, in turn, reduce the number of chloramines created.

1. The Swim Ultra 16 Mil

SPECIFICATIONS

Thickness: 16-mil

Size: 12-foot


PROS


+Durable


CONS


-Not many users reviews


Because it is thick and long-lasting, the In the Swim Ultra 16 Mil Solar Cover is designed to protect your pool from the elements while maintaining its cleanliness and temperature. This solar pool cover came from a spherical blanket and was created to safeguard your pool while maintaining a comfortable temperature in the water.


The top layer of this blanket is constructed of polyethylene, and the bottom layer of this blanket is aluminized. The small air pockets in the aluminized layer help to maintain your water at an ideal temperature. Because of this substantial covering, the temperature of your pool might rise by as much as 18 degrees. You will not waste any of the sunlight that comes through the windows since the bottom layer is aluminized and reflects heat back into the water.


Pondering its eight-year warranty and thickness, this solar pool cover offers an exceptional price-to-value ratio. Although there aren't many reviews for this cover, one user referred to it as "heavy-duty" and said they liked it.

2. Sun2Solar 1200 Series Solar Pool Cover


SPECIFICATIONS

Thickness: 16-mil

Size: 16 x 32-foot


PROS


+Great for in-ground and above-ground pools


CONS


-Expensive


The Sun2Solar 1200 Series Solar Pool Cover is an excellent choice for covering swimming pools that are either in-ground or above-ground. Although it has an oval form, you are free to trim it to make it more appropriate for your swimming pool and doing so will not void your guarantee.


Even on overcast days, the water in your pool will remain comfortably warm due to the little air pockets on the bottom of the blanket. This heat is captured by the sun and sent back into the pool. You can select a blue or transparent blanket; however, the one that is clear is the one that we would prefer since sunlight may penetrate right into the water.


However, other solar pool covers are considerably more affordable than this one, even though it is one of the costliest ones that we've looked into. On Amazon, customers give this Sun2Solar pool cover an average rating of 4.5 stars out of a possible 5, making it the product with the highest possible rating. Users who favor the solar pool cover often comment that they find it to be "strong enough that it won't rip." Additionally, the opinion of others was that it was robust and substantial. After several years of usage, it was noted by several customers that the bubbles started to separate.

3. Blue Wave NS120

SPECIFICATIONS

Thickness: 12-mil

Size: 24 ft


PROS

+Great value


CONS


-Some negative user reviews


Because this solar blanket from In The Swim is 12 mils thick, it will easily maintain the water temperature in your pool. The form of this specific model is oval; however, the manufacturer offers various other models with varying sizes and shapes.


Because of its construction out of UV-stabilized resin, it can endure the sun's rays and bring the temperature of your family pool up by 15 degrees. The bottom side of the blanket has a pattern that looks a bit like bubble wrap due to small air bubbles. However, the bubbles and the thickness of the blanket work together to retain heat in your pool and protect it from any adverse weather.


This solar pool cover comes with an outstanding guarantee that lasts for seven years, and the seams have been strengthened to prevent rips from occurring. On its website, the In The Swim Premium Plus has received a user rating of 4.6 stars out of 5. Users were pleased with how successfully this pool cover maintained their pool temperature, and several commented on how well it prevented debris from falling into their pool. Several swimmers voiced their disapproval of the pool cover, arguing that it did little to increase the temperature of the water.

4. Blue Wave NS120


SPECIFICATIONS

Thickness: 8-mid

Size: 24-foot


PROS

+Effectively warms up the water


CONS

-Thin


The Blue Wave NS120 is a solar pool blanket made up of tiny bubbles that insulate your swimming pool and may enhance the temperature of your pool by up to 15 degrees Fahrenheit. This improvement in temperature is possible because the bubbles act as insulation.


This solar pool cover is designed to withstand the wear and tear caused by ultraviolet (UV) radiation and the chemicals used to clean the water in your pool. This is because the solar pool cover will be placed in direct sunlight. In our roundup of solar pool covers, the Blue Wave solar pool cover is one of the more expensive alternatives; however, for the price that you pay, you do receive a guarantee that lasts for three years.


Because this solar pool cover is circular, it will not be suitable for use on square pools. Additionally, it was developed for use in above-ground swimming pools. However, the manufacturer asserts that it can stop up to "95% of pool water and chemical evaporation." This implies that you won't have to spend as much time or money maintaining your pool as you normally would.


On Amazon, customers give the Blue Wave NS120 an average rating of 3.7 stars out of a possible 5. Customers who have purchased and used this solar pool cover remarked that it "increased the water temperature over 20 degrees in a week." Some people said it was simple to remove from the pool and praised its long-lasting quality. Some customers experienced problems with the bubbles popping and dissolving, which led to the criticism that this solar pool cover is "thin." Other criticisms include the assertion that the cover is "thin."

5. In The Swim Premium 12 Mil


SPECIFICATIONS

Thickness: 12-mil

Size: 12-foot


PROS

+Good warranty


CONS

-No clear-colored option


The In The Swim Premium 12 Mil Solar Blanket is constructed out of polyethylene. Due to its material's thickness, it can boost the temperature of your pool by up to 15 degrees Fahrenheit. This can be a significant assist in lowering overall heating expenditures.


Raised air pockets on the surface of this thick blanket keep the water in your pool from evaporating and protect it from things like falling tree branches or rubbish, not to mention little insects you would rather not have around. In addition to retaining heat, the air bubbles are responsible for the warmth of your pool. The fact that this thick solar blanket makes it rather long-lasting, but the seven-year guarantee that comes with it is what sets it apart from the competition and gives you more peace of mind.


In addition, UV-stabilized resin has been included in this solar pool cover to further protect the pool from the sun's potentially harmful rays. It also doesn't matter if your pool isn't spherical because you can customize the size of this pool cover to fit any pool.


The In the Swim 12 Mil Solar Pool Blanket receives an average rating of 4.5 out of five stars on the company's website, even though there are few reviews available for this product. Users have reported that the water is efficiently warmed by using it.
